node.title: Man Shoots at Wife And Her Brother After She Lands at Tulsa Airportâ€”Police
node.description: An officer was shot in the chest during the gunfire, but is expected to recover as he was wearing a bulletproof vest.
node.content: ["Police say a husband started shooting at his wife shortly after she landed at Tulsa airport.", "The couple had gotten into a fight in Houston, Texas, over Thanksgiving. The husband returned to Tulsa alone, but had threatened serious harm to his wife when she landed at Tulsa International Airport (TIA), Captain Jerrod Hart told KRMG radio station.", "TIA police escorted the woman to her brother's car after she landed late on Tuesday night.", "Hart says her husband then ran out of a nearby parking garage and started firing at his wife and her brother. Both managed to avoid being injured, he said.", "A TIA officer was shot in the chest, but is expected to recover as he was wearing a bulletproof vest, Hart told KRMG.", "The husband, who has not named, was shot in the foot and taken to hospital. He will be taken into custody after undergoing surgery police said.", "Fox23 reporter Julia Gorman tweeted that an airport transit van with five people inside, including a young child, got caught up in the shooting. Some of the people in the van were hit by shrapnel, but sustained no serious injuries, according to KRMG.", "This is a breaking news story and will be updated.", ""]
